indications:
Indications travellers’ diarrhoea that is
not associated with fever, bloody diarrhoea, blood or leucocytes in
the stool, or 8 or more unformed stools in the previous 24 hours
name: RIFAXIMIN
side-effects:
Side-effects nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, flatulence,
headache, dizziness; less commonly taste disturbances,
peripheral oedema, sleep disturbances, nervousness, hypoaesthesia,
paraesthesia, influenza-like symptoms, polyuria, glycosuria, polymenorrhoea,
blood disorders, rash; also reported antibiotic-associated
colitis, pruritis
doses:
adult over 18 years, 200 mg
every 8 hours for 3 days
pregnancy: Pregnancy manufacturer advises avoid—toxicity in animal studies
